page.title: 01Beaumont & Burgh Parishes
page.content: Local placenames give the clue to the terrain of the area: {Burgh by SANDS, BeauMONT, Kirkandrews {ON EDEN, MonkHILL, RockCLIFFE Undulating pasture, interspersed with fields of cereal crops for animal feed, leads down to the River Eden via the sea-washed Burgh Marsh on which sheep and cattle graze. Passing east to west through the area is the line of the Roman Wall with a disused railway and canal taking the approximate line of its vallum. Many buildings are colour washed and older ones, even cruck houses with wattle and daub walls, survive. The main local occupations are related to farming activities but a large proportion of the population commutes to Carlisle.
